lines: (The tunnel we used to escape the academy was narrow and treacherous.)
(Seeing the light of the forest offered only a moment's respite when we could still hear the revelling rebels pillage our home from the hills behind us.)
(We made our way to the gates of a nearby village, crossing paths with merchants and families who were fleeing the inevitable path of the soldiers.)
(A caravan offered to let us travel with them to increase the number of able bodies on the road. The offer was accepted with gratitude.)
(However, there was someone being less amicable.)

lines.Makari-Hari: "I never expected for there to only be two Crown Mages left!"
"And now we have to escape while concealing ourselves among the poor?"

lines.Mukaki: "What? Are you looking down on the less fortunate?"

lines.Makari-Hari: "How so?"
"Social hierarchies always get established in the domains of mrotals. You're the one bringing up trivial issues here."
"Clearly you recognize this reality if you are willing to call them "less fortunate"."

lines.Mukaki: "You haven't changed, have you? Always willing to argue."

lines.Makari-Hari: "And you certainly haven't shaken your predisposition to assume."

lines.Vitus: "You two have been at this since we set off, the headache is killing me."
"Not to mention that I can't address or do anything about you two in front of other people..."

lines.Volesus: "Why does it seem that other people cannot see you?"

lines.Mukaki: "Don't ask me."

lines.Makari-Hari: "Only Crown Mages are capable of seeing us."
"The restults of your meditations since childhood have made this possible for you two."

lines.Volesus: "That sounds like a lie, but fascinating."

lines.Vitus: "What I'm more concerned about right now is whether or not you two can stop bickering."

lines.Makari-Hari: "Well that really depends on..."

lines.Volesus: "Damn! It looks like a group of bandits blocked the road up ahead."

lines.Vitus: "No, this isn't good! We're not fit for combat!"

lines.Makari-Hari: "What about the people we're with?"

lines.Volesus: "Hell if I know! We're just random band of reguees. They don't look like they know how to fight..."

lines.Mukaki: "Any weapons?"

lines.Volesus: "We might be able to repurpose our tools or utensils for offence, but that's about it."
"I also have this relic of a spear I took from the altar, but I highly doubt it's usable in its current state."

lines.Makari-Hari: "That's it! The spear!"

lines.Mukaki: "Looks like the mortals are saved."

lines.Makari-Hari: "It would seem so."
"Listen up. I'm going to teach you the Ritual of Summoning. Right here, right now."

lines.Volesus: "Ritual of Summoning? Our mentor used to speak about it, but he said it was lost forever."

lines.Vitus: "He demonstrated the ritual to use when we were young, but nothing came from it."

lines.Makari-Hari: "How far has this guild fallen... But no matter. I can teach you two."

lines.Mukaki: "Hold your tongue, I can teach them as well!"
"Listen, so long as you have their artefact, you have the power to summon the Heroes of the past!"

lines.Volesus: "And this spear right here is one of those artefacts?"

lines.Makari-Hari: "That's correct."
"Additionally, the summoned Hero will temporarily become a physical entity and walk this land."

lines.Mukaki: "With the strength of a Hero, trouncing these bandits will be simple."

lines.Makari-Hari: "So if you will, lend me your ear and follow my instructions..."

lines.Mukaki: "No, listen to me! You can do it this way..."

lines.Makari-Hari: "Ignore him! I will show you how!"

lines.Mukaki: "No! My words are better―I will get straight to the point!"

lines.Vitus: "Stop it! You can teach one of us each!"

lines.Makari-Hari: "Very well. We have no time to waste."

lines.Mukaki: "Alright, go ahead and give it a shot."

lines.Herclaus: "I, Herclaus, the Guardian of the Holy Capital, hear your call."

lines.Volesus: "You're Herclaus? Like, as in, the legendary Hero?"
"Oh wow, I wasn't aware that we had brought the Spear of Herclaus with us!"

lines.Herclaus: "It is an honour to be summoned."

lines.Mukaki: "Nice! With Herclaus here, this will be a trivial matter. Hurry and take care of these bandits, will you?"

lines.Makari-Hari: "Wait, we're taking the initiative?"
"No, no, that's too dangerous! They're the last Crown Mages!"

lines.Mukaki: "So, what, do you wish to stand around aimlessly and let them make their move?"

lines.Makari-Hari: "We should set up our defensive perimeter and monitor their movements."
"It is far safer than being the aggressor!"

lines.Herclaus: "My apologies for intruding. What is the current situation?"

lines.Vitus: "We're on the run with these refugees, but a group of thieves are blocking the road for our carriage."
"I am unsure why they haven't made their way over here yet..."

lines.Herclaus: "It seems that they are aware of our presence, and they know that we do not have an alternative pathway around."
"I do not believe they will attack immediately, but we had best prepare ourselves."

lines.Mukaki: "This is exactly why we should just make the first move!"

lines.Makari-Hari: "Why is that?"
"It would make more sense to ready ourselves for their advance."

lines.Mukaki: "I was never able to talk sense into you!"
"You just want to act against me!"

lines.Makari-Hari: "I don't! This is simply a matter of principle!"

lines.Vitus: "Could you two not do this right now?"

lines.Mukaki: "Mortal, this is in your interest so pay heed."
"In the end, this will also be your battle!"

lines.Makari-Hari: "I must agree with Vitus. We should cease this discussion and focus on defence."

lines.Mukaki: "How do you expect to defend this flimsy carriage? Surely an offensive approach is better!"

lines.Makari-Hari: "How do you not listen to my wisdom?"

lines.Mukaki: "Wisdom? Listen to what I know is right!"

lines.Volesus: "...Really? I believe the alternative was far more reasonable."
"This is actual combat, we need to make it out of this, together!"

lines.Vitus: "So, what do you want to do? We need to decide quickly."

lines.Volesus: "Their lives are also at stake in this."

lines.Mukaki: "Hah! I have no doubt that the people will know my approach far superior!"

lines.Makari-Hari: "I do not expect much wisdom from a group of refugees, but I trust they will choose the safest option."

lines.Herclaus: "To be frank, there is no need to bicker amongst ourselves. I cannot possibe lose to a petty band of thieves."

lines.(If the player listens to Mukaki): (Vitus convinces the refugees that defence is the wisest way to get past the bandits.)

lines.(If the player listens to Makari-Hari): (Vitus convinces the refugees that he knows offence is the best way to get past the bandits.)
